data.title: Fernando Pessoa
data.text:
Fernando Pessoa: Bibliography

Selected Bibliography

Collected Poems of Álvaro de Campos, Vol. 2, 1928–1935, Translated from the Portuguese by Chris Daniels, Exeter (UK): Shearsman Books, 2009.

Lisbon - What the Tourist Should See, Exeter (UK): Shearsman Books, 2008. ISBN 978190570752

The Collected Poems of Alberto Caeiro, Translated from the Portuguese by Chris Daniels, Exeter (UK): Shearsman Books, 2007.

Selected English Poems, Exeter (UK): Shearsman Books, 2007.

Message, Translated from the Portuguese by Jonathan Griffin, Exeter (UK): Shearsman Books, 2007.

Selected English Poems , ed. Tony Frazer, Exeter (UK): Shearsman Books, 2007.

The Collected Poems of Alberto Caeiro, tr. Chris Daniels, Exeter (UK): Shearsman Books, 2007.

A Centenary Pessoa, tr. Keith Bosley & L. C. Taylor, foreword by Octavio Paz, Carcanet Press, 2006.

A Little Larger Than the Entire Universe: Selected Poems, tr. Richard Zenith, Penguin Classics, 2006.

The Education of the Stoic, tr. Richard Zenith, afterword by Antonio Tabucchi, Exact Change, 2004.

The Book of Disquiet, tr. Richard Zenith, Penguin classics, 2003.

The Selected Prose of Fernando Pessoa, tr. Richard Zenith, Grove Press, 2002.

Sheep's Vigil by a Fervent Person: A Translation of Alberto Caeiro, tr. Eirin Moure, House of Anansi, 2001.

Selected Poems: with New Supplement tr. Jonathan Griffin, Penguin Classics; 2nd edition, 2000.

Fernando Pessoa & Co: Selected Poems, tr. Richard Zenith, Grove Press, 1999.

Poems of Fernando Pessoa, anthology ed. & tr. Edwin Honig & Susan M. Brown, City Lights Publishers, 1998.

The Keeper of Sheep, bilingual edition, tr. Edwin Honig & Susan M. Brown, Sheep Meadow, 1997.

Message, tr. Jonathan Griffin, introduction by Helder Macedo, Menard Press, 1992.

The Book of Disquietude, tr. Richard Zenith, Carcanet Press, 1991.

The Book of Disquiet, tr. Iain Watson, Quartet Books, 1991.

The Book of Disquiet, tr. Alfred Mac Adam, New York NY: Pantheon Books, 1991.

The Book of Disquiet, tr. Margaret Jull Costa, London, New York NY: Serpent's Tail, 1991,

Fernando Pessoa: Self-Analysis and Thirty Other Poems, tr. George Monteiro, Gavea-Brown Publications, 1989.

Always Astonished, tr. Edwin Honig, San Francisco CA: City Lights, 1988.

Selected Poems by Fernando Pessoa, tr. Edwin Honig, Swallow Press, 1971. ISBN B000XU4FE4

ENGLISH POEMS by Fernando Pessoa, 2 vol. ( vol. 1 part I - Antinous, part II - Inscriptions; vol. 2 part III - Epithalamium), Lisbon: Olisipo, 1921 (vol. 1 - 20 p., vol. 2 - 16 p., 24 cm).

35 SONNETS by Fernando Pessoa, Lisbon: Monteiro & Co., 1918 (20 p., 20 cm).

ANTINOUS: a poem by Fernando Pessoa, Lisbon: Monteiro & Co., 1918 (16 p., 20 cm).
